definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
as/as if/such as
surname Zuo
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
variant of 針|针[zhen1], needle
felt (fabric)
variant of 氈|毡[zhan1]

sentences.english: Until then, its PR representatives are in a tough spot.
sentences.chinese: 但在此之前，三星公司的公关代表都会如坐针毡。

sentences.english: For the last few months, he has been on a bed of thorns.
sentences.chinese: 近几个月他一直烦虑不安，如坐针毡。

sentences.english: At minimum, that would unsettle Japan to the north and the Philippines to the south.
sentences.chinese: 起码，这可以令以北的日本和以南的菲律宾如坐针毡。

sentences.english: He was on tenterhooks of expectation during our conversation .
sentences.chinese: 在我们谈话的时候，他因有所期待而如坐针毡。

sentences.english: I found him on tenterhooks when he was waiting for his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 在我们谈话时，他因有所期待而如坐针毡。

sentences.english: I was jumping out of my skin worrying about my exam results.
sentences.chinese: 我很担心考试结果，感觉如坐针毡。

sentences.english: This is making some foreign-exchange participants edgy.
sentences.chinese: 一些外汇市场的参与者为此如坐针毡。

sentences.english: Mrs. Watson sat on pins and needles.
The colonel, on pins and needles, did what he could to speed up the departure of the countryside guests.
sentences.chinese: 如坐针毡的上校尽快打发走了乡下的来宾。

sentences.english: The father-to-be is on pins and needles.
sentences.chinese: 即将成为父亲的人紧张地如坐针毡。

sentences.english: The movie kept us on tenterhooks for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 这电影使我们如坐针毡了两个小时之久。

definition: unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
lit. agitated sitting or standing (idiom)/restless/fidgety
feeling brambles and thorns in one's back (idiom)/uneasy and nervous/to be on pins and needles
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
anxious/panicky
panic-stricken
to be restless
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
needle felting (craft)/piece of felt used as a pincushion
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
a day drags past like a year (idiom); time hangs heavy/time crawls when one is wretched
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
restless/apprehensive
